title.narrative: Project ARC Ethiopia Norwegian Refugee Council

description.narrative: This is a project by NRC Ethiopia implemented under the ARC consortium programme named Hope and Opportunities for the People in Ethiopia.
3rd installment to NRC from ZOA
Expenditures NRC 2019

title.narrative: Advocacy w. government on access to services (activity 3.4)

description.narrative: Advocacy with government on access to basic services (activity 3.4)

title.narrative: Conduct sensitization and advocacy workshops (Federal/Regional/local) with agencies and government on how to address access barriers identified and improve quality of services; for communities, conduct awareness raising on available services and how to access these services including information on the status of refugees in order to reduce discrimination and stigmatization in the school community.

description.narrative: Number of workshops conducted

title.narrative: Organized workshops and capacity building sessions on OCP and migration policies.

description.narrative: Collaboration with line-ministries (activity 4.2)

title.narrative: Collaborating with line ministries (including ARRA, Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs) taking strides against illegal migration.

description.narrative: Regular (number and frequency) meetings with line ministries

description.narrative: Documentation and dissemination of good practices (activity 1.3)

title.narrative: Dissemination of materials on OCP and migration policies as documented from assessments, workshops and colloquia.

Establishment of (mobile) information centres (activity 3.3)

title.narrative: Construct and equip information centres (including mobile units) on basic services and migration for information dissemination, including production of IEC materials and establishment of information services at existing centres.

description.narrative: Number of information centres constructed and equipped
Number of information centres constructed and equipped

title.narrative: Establishment of round-tables (activity 2.1)

description.narrative: Establishment of round-tables (activity 2.1)

title.narrative: Organize stakeholder meetings (round table) with both government and training institutes as well as private sector representatives to identify the best ways forward for creating traineeship and employment opportunity for youth at risk of migration at local and federal levels.

description.narrative: Number and frequency of stakeholder meetings (round tables) held

title.narrative: Facilitation of access to financial resources (activity 2.3)

description.narrative: Facilitation of access to financial resources (activity 2.3)

title.narrative: Promote and provide access to finance through grant (material and finance) start-up for small business, microfinance institutions savings and loans (formal and informal), VSLA groups, self-help groups, and small business revolving funds.

description.narrative: Number of groups facilitated to access to finance

title.narrative: Facilitation of linkages between existing networks (act. 4.1

description.narrative: Facilitation of linkages between existing networks (diaspora, migrants, repatriates) and existing information structures (activity 4.1)

title.narrative: Conduct Migration Pattern Study (done during CN phase) and perform review/update to inform adaptive programming.

description.narrative: Study completed and reviews conducted

title.narrative: Networks for mentorship (activity 2.6)

description.narrative: Networks for mentorship (activity 2.6)

title.narrative: Facilitate employment through the development of network of young professionals, linking youth (Ethiopian and refugee) with internships, job placement and recruitment opportunities and organising job fairs.

description.narrative: Number of programme beneficiaries facilitated to work

title.narrative: Provision of information on basic services (activity 3.1/3.2

description.narrative: Provision of information on basic services (activities 3.1 & 3.2)

title.narrative: Establish referral pathway (including workshops and training) for information centres to health centres, legal assistance, psychosocial support, education and others ensuring coordination.

description.narrative: Number of programme beneficiaries referred to basic services

title.narrative: Mapping and documentation of affordable basic services available and identify barriers to communities’ access to services.

description.narrative: Number of providers of basic services in programme areas identified

title.narrative: Psychosocial support with integration of messaging (act.4.4)

description.narrative: Psychosocial support with integration of migrant messaging (activity 4.4)

title.narrative: Youth engagement against irregular migration through psychosocial support with integrated migration messaging including organised youth sports, youth recreation centre support, youth groups (computer studio), and child friendly spaces.

description.narrative: Number of youth reached with massages on migration

title.narrative: Sending messages to migrants via mass/social media (act.4.3)

description.narrative: Sending messages to young migrants via mass & social media (activity 4.3)

title.narrative: Organize awareness raising and campaigns for refugee and Ethiopian migrants on the realities of migration [en route and destination with special attention to youth (14-18), young women and girls] through: Seminars/platforms involving discussions for refugees and diaspora and returnees as a mean for learning and enlightenment; Interactive information and dialogue platforms using documentary video; Mass and mini media tools such as radio programmes, IEC materials migration to disseminate information to increase public awareness; Production and dissemination of magazine containing personal stories about irregular migration in different languages; Establishment and maintaining a Migration desk at the information centres (social media group, formal/informal information on migration, database of repatriates and diaspora, etc.).

description.narrative: Number of awareness raising campaigns organised

description.narrative: Soft advocacy on OCP with major stakeholders (activity 1.1)

title.narrative: Review/assessment of OCP opportunities and challenges, including round table discussions with ARRA (and other relevant actors) to clarify OCP.

description.narrative: Number of round table discussions with ARRA (and other stakeholders) on OCP

title.narrative: Conduct Labour Market Assessment and perform annual review/update to inform adaptive programming; study value chains and identify interested local entrepreneurs.

title.narrative: Provision of psychosocial services for youth through child-friendly spaces (discussion sessions, mentoring sessions, outdoor games/materials, in-door games materials).

description.narrative: Number of children benefiting from psychosocial services

title.narrative: Provide training and credit system for costs related to basic services, child-care services, micro-insurances and risk analysis.

description.narrative: Number of participants completing the training courses

title.narrative: Skills training matching labour demand (activities 2.4 & 2.5

description.narrative: Tailor-made skills training for youth matching the labour demand (activities 2.4 & 2.5)

title.narrative: Promote and provide skills/trainings: life skills, vocational and entrepreneurship training (linking with TVET institutes), business skills/development trainings (market oriented), technical mentorship, cooperative groups, promotion of indigenous revivable talents for youth/women, self-employment (off-farm activities) and supportive follow-up to host and refugee communities.

description.narrative: Number (%) of participants completing training courses

title.narrative: Strengthen and furnish existing training centres.

description.narrative: Number of training centres supported
